header: Israel Rejects the Lord as King

verse: When Samuel was old, he made his sons judges over Israel.
The name of his firstborn son was Joel; the name of his second son was Abijah. They were judges in Beersheba.
The sons didn’t follow their father’s example but turned to dishonest ways of making money. They took bribes and denied people justice.
Then all the leaders of Israel gathered together and came to Samuel at Ramah.
They told him, “You’re old, and your sons aren’t following your example. Now appoint a king to judge us so that we will be like all the other nations.”
But Samuel considered it wrong for them to request a king to judge them. So Samuel prayed to Yahweh.
Yahweh told Samuel, “Listen to everything the people are saying to you. They haven’t rejected you; they’ve rejected me.
They’re doing just what they’ve done since I took them out of Egypt—leaving me and serving other gods.
Listen to them now, but be sure to warn them and tell them about the rights of a king.”
Then Samuel told the people who had asked him for a king everything Yahweh had said.
Samuel said, “These are the rights of a king:
He will appoint them to be his officers over 1,000 or over 50 soldiers, to plow his ground and harvest his crops, and to make weapons and equipment for his chariots.
He will take your daughters and have them make perfumes, cook, and bake.
He will take the best of your fields, vineyards, and olive orchards and give them to his officials.
He will take a tenth of your grain and wine and give it to his aids and officials.
He will take your male and female slaves, your best cattle, and your donkeys for his own use.
He will take a tenth of your flocks.
“When that day comes, you will cry out because of the king whom you have chosen for yourselves. Yahweh will not answer you when that day comes.”
But the people refused to listen to Samuel. They said, “No, we want a king!
Then we, too, will be like all the other nations. Our king will judge us, lead us out to war, and fight our battles.”
When Samuel heard everything the people had to say, he reported it privately to Yahweh.
Yahweh told him, “Listen to them, and give them a king.”
